pageTitle: Pololu - Programming Orangutans and the 3pi Robot from the Arduino Environment
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {98938=© 2001–2015 Pololu Corporation, 45425=As of version 101215, the C versions of the library functions are also available for use in your Arduino programs. This means that there are three possible ways for you to call library methods:}
textBeforeTable: Pin Assignment Table Sorted by Function Orangutan LV-168 bottom view with dimensions (Arduino pin mapping). Orangutan SV-168 bottom view with dimensions (Arduino pin mapping). 2.a. Orangutan SV-xx8 and LV-168 Pin Mappings You can visit http://www.arduino.cc/en/Hacking/PinMapping168 to see exactly how the mega168/328 pins are mapped to Arduino pins. Note that this page shows a 28-pin DIP package chip while the Orangutans carry smaller 32-pin MLF packages that contain two additional dedicated analog inputs: ADC6 and ADC7. In the Arduino environment, these pins become arduino analog inputs 6 and 7, respectively. The following diagram comes from the page linked above: The Arduino insulates the user from this
